skill.name: changelog
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changelog, documenting releases, or reviewing commits/PRs for changelog entries.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changel...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It provides instructions for maintaining the IdeaVim changelog and contains no security risks.

content.value_statement: Keeping changelogs updated is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates the process by analyzing commits, PRs, and releases to generate accurate, user-focused changelog entries.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes git commits and PRs to identify changelog-worthy changes
Maintains consistent changelog format with Features, Fixes, and Changes sections
Updates both CHANGES.md and build.gradle.kts changeNotes simultaneously
Filters out internal changes and focuses on user-visible improvements
Handles version gaps and maintains historical context
limitations: Specifically designed for IdeaVim project structure and conventions
Requires manual review before creating PR

use_cases.title: Automate release documentation
use_cases.description: Keep your project's changelog updated with minimal effort by automatically analyzing commits and PRs for user-facing changes.

use_cases.title: Standardize release notes
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent, professional release documentation that follows established patterns and includes proper references to issues and PRs.

use_cases.title: Document community contributions
use_cases.description: Properly acknowledge external contributors by automatically including their PRs in the changelog, even for internal changes.

prompt_templates.title: Update changelog for new release
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the IdeaVim changelog for the upcoming 2.29.0 release. Check commits since the last documented version and include all user-facing changes.

prompt_templates.title: Add recent changes to [To Be Released]
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the [To Be Released] section with recent commits from the master branch. Focus on user-visible features and bug fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Review PR for changelog entry
prompt_templates.scenario: Checking if a PR needs documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review PR #1234 and determine if it needs a changelog entry. If so, prepare the appropriate entry following the changelog format.

prompt_templates.title: Generate changeNotes HTML
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the latest [To Be Released] changelog entries to HTML format for the build.gradle.kts changeNotes section.

output_examples.input: Update changelog for commits since last release
output: * Added support for `g;` and `g,` commands to navigate through change list
* Implemented `:history` command to show command history
* [VIM-3456](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/VIM-3456) Fixed visual block mode with wrapped lines
* [VIM-3458](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/VIM-3458) Fixed `ci"` in strings with escaped quotes
* [850](https://github.com/JetBrains/ideavim/pull/850) by contributor: Add surround plugin improvements

best_practices: Always review generated changelog entries for accuracy and clarity before committing
Include specific examples of commands or features when describing fixes or new functionality
Link to relevant documentation or JetBrains blog posts for new IntelliJ integrations
anti_patterns: Don't include internal refactoring or code cleanup that doesn't affect users
Avoid vague descriptions like "Fixed bugs" without specifying what was fixed
Never skip the manual review step - automated changelog still needs human verification

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with non-IdeaVim projects?
faq.answer: No, it's specifically designed for IdeaVim's changelog format and conventions. Other projects would need adaptation.

faq.question: How does it handle the changelog gap between versions 2.9.0 and 2.28.0?
faq.answer: It automatically includes a note about the unmaintained period and continues documentation from 2.28.0 onwards.

faq.question: Can it automatically create and merge PRs?
faq.answer: No, it only prepares the changelog content. You must manually create and review the PR before merging.

faq.question: Is my code and commit history safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads git history and generates text. It doesn't modify code or send data externally.

faq.question: What if the skill misses an important change?
faq.answer: Manual review is required. You can always add or modify entries before creating the PR.

faq.question: How does it differ from automatic git log generators?
faq.answer: It focuses on user-visible changes, filters internal updates, and follows specific formatting rules for IdeaVim's audience.
